title: Synthetic Recap
body:
DENVER – On a night destined for the record books, a young star named Tracy McGrady authored a performance for the ages, single-handedly lifting the Toronto Raptors to a stunning 84-80 victory over the Denver Nuggets.

In just his second season, McGrady was simply unguardable, erupting for a career-high and franchise-record 45 points. He was a whirlwind of athleticism and raw power, attacking the rim with a ferocity the Nuggets had no answer for. His final stat line—45 points, 11 rebounds, and 6 assists—was a testament to his complete dominance, accounting for well over half of his team's total output in a gritty, defensive struggle.

While McGrady’s offensive explosion was the headline, the Raptors’ defense provided the crucial final chapter. Holding a narrow lead in the game's dying moments, Toronto’s defense clamped down, forcing a critical shot clock violation against the Nuggets that sealed the fate of the contest. It was a fitting end, as Denver simply could not find a solution for the one-man force wearing purple and black.

This was more than just a road win; it was a star-making moment. McGrady’s 45-point outburst announced his arrival as a premier talent in the league, a player capable of carrying a franchise on his back. On a night where every possession mattered, one phenomenal talent mattered most, and his name was Tracy McGrady.
